cwe: CWE-95
message: Found data from an Express or Next web request flowing to `eval`. If this data is user-controllable this can lead to execution of arbitrary system commands in the context of your application process. Avoid `eval` whenever possible.

representative.message: Found data from an Express or Next web request flowing to `eval`. If this data is user-controllable this can lead to execution of arbitrary system commands in the context of your application process. Avoid `eval` whenever possible.

extra.message: Found data from an Express or Next web request flowing to `eval`. If this data is user-controllable this can lead to execution of arbitrary system commands in the context of your application process. Avoid `eval` whenever possible.

cwe: CWE-95: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')

cwe: CWE-601
message: The application redirects to a URL specified by user-supplied input `req` that is not validated. This could redirect users to malicious locations. Consider using an allow-list approach to validate URLs, or warn users they are being redirected to a third-party website.

representative.message: The application redirects to a URL specified by user-supplied input `req` that is not validated. This could redirect users to malicious locations. Consider using an allow-list approach to validate URLs, or warn users they are being redirected to a third-party website.

cwe: CWE-522
message: Dont use the default session cookie name Using the default session cookie name can open your app to attacks. The security issue posed is similar to X-Powered-By: a potential attacker can use it to fingerprint the server and target attacks accordingly.

representative.message: Dont use the default session cookie name Using the default session cookie name can open your app to attacks. The security issue posed is similar to X-Powered-By: a potential attacker can use it to fingerprint the server and target attacks accordingly.

extra.message: Dont use the default session cookie name Using the default session cookie name can open your app to attacks. The security issue posed is similar to X-Powered-By: a potential attacker can use it to fingerprint the server and target attacks accordingly.

cwe: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

members.message: Default session middleware settings: `domain` not set. It indicates the domain of the cookie; use it to compare against the domain of the server in which the URL is being requested. If they match, then check the path attribute next.

extra.message: Default session middleware settings: `domain` not set. It indicates the domain of the cookie; use it to compare against the domain of the server in which the URL is being requested. If they match, then check the path attribute next.

cwe: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

members.message: Default session middleware settings: `expires` not set. Use it to set expiration date for persistent cookies.

extra.message: Default session middleware settings: `expires` not set. Use it to set expiration date for persistent cookies.

cwe: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

members.message: Default session middleware settings: `httpOnly` not set. It ensures the cookie is sent only over HTTP(S), not client JavaScript, helping to protect against cross-site scripting attacks.

extra.message: Default session middleware settings: `httpOnly` not set. It ensures the cookie is sent only over HTTP(S), not client JavaScript, helping to protect against cross-site scripting attacks.

cwe: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

cwe: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

members.message: Default session middleware settings: `path` not set. It indicates the path of the cookie; use it to compare against the request path. If this and domain match, then send the cookie in the request.

extra.message: Default session middleware settings: `path` not set. It indicates the path of the cookie; use it to compare against the request path. If this and domain match, then send the cookie in the request.

members.message: Default session middleware settings: `secure` not set. It ensures the browser only sends the cookie over HTTPS.
